intro: Basanacantha macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and milky sap. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its large, fleshy fruits are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Basanacantha macrocarpa thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
